results.title: Zinc
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Principles of Chemical Processes”.
Electrochemistry, thermodynamics and chemical kinetics are used to provide the basis for explaining the industrial extraction of zinc from its ores.

results.title: Zebras
results.creator_credit: Choice Films and GK Film, Stockholm
results.brief_description: An animated film of uncommon warmth and humor by the Swedish artist Johan Hagelback. Two zebras happily discover each other, and then, unhappily, lose one of their stripes. They investigate every visible form and shape until they recover the vital black stripe of their own.

results.title: Yuzen kimono
results.brief_description: Shows how the Yuzen-Kimono is made in Kyoto. We follow the process from the designing and making of the wide variety of beautiful hand painted materials, the hand sewing of the traditional kimonos and finally the wearing of them by children and women of all ages on special occasions in the ancient city of Kyoto. Without commentary - music only with English intertitles.

results.title: Your local council
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Reviews the work of local councils in Australia in providing essential services and amenities in the community. Outlines the services provided by local government. Includes interesting scenes of city and country life and times of the early 1950’s in Eastern Australia.

results.title: Your house in order?
results.creator_credit: Philip Owtram, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Deals with a neglected subject - industrial housekeeping - and the accidents that can be attributed either directly or indirectly to bad housekeeping methods. It sets out to promote the right attitude of mind.

results.title: Your children's ears
results.creator_credit: Albert Pearl, Margaret Thomson, C O I and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This film opens with a sequence showing children in school; these children are all deaf, some from birth, but the majority of them as a result of common aliments like measles, influenza, tonsillitis, and other ear-nose-and-throat diseases which, if not properly cared for, can cause total or partial deafness. A very clear explanation of the structure of the ear and the care which should be taken of everyday complaints, is given.
